    • Method Detail

      • insertionSort

        public static void insertionSort(java.lang.String[][] unsortedData)
        Sorts data using insertion sort
        Parameters:
        unsortedData - a 2d string array of the unsorted data with each row representing one record and the nought element containing a String primary key (which is the field that will be used to sort)

      • mergeSort

        public static java.lang.String[][] mergeSort(java.lang.String[][] data)
        This function recursively splits all record down into sub arrays until each sub array only contains one record these split arrays are merged back together using the merge function. Therefore the data originally input into this function will be sorted (as arrays are passed by reference in java). The return value of this function is also the sorted data.
        Parameters:
        data - The data you want sorted. Assuming each row is one record and the first element in each row is a string that is the primary key.
        Returns:
        The sorted data is returned with the data being sorted in ascending order (one row representing each record and the first element of each row containing the integer primary key).

      • merge

        private static java.lang.String[][] merge(java.lang.String[][] left,
                                          java.lang.String[][] right,
                                          java.lang.String[][] dataToBeSorted)
        Parameters:
        left - the left hand sub array of data
        right - the right hand sub array of data
        dataToBeSorted - the data to be sorted
        Returns:
        returns the merged / sorted data

      • quickSortUsingIntAtFirstElement

        public static void quickSortUsingIntAtFirstElement(java.lang.String[][] arr)
        Sorts the array using quicksort. The nought element of every row in the array must be an integer
        Parameters:
        arr - The array to sort

      • quickSortInt

        private static void quickSortInt(int first,
                                 int last,
                                 java.lang.String[][] arr)
        Performs a quick sort assuming that each record in the array contains an integer value at the nought element.
        Parameters:
        first - A parameter used during quicksort
        last - A parameter used during quicksort
        arr - The array to sort

      • mergeSortInt

        public static int[][] mergeSortInt(int[][] data)
        performs a merge sort on the array provided
        Parameters:
        data - The array to sort
        Returns:
        The sorted data

      • mergeInt

        private static int[][] mergeInt(int[][] left,
                                int[][] right,
                                int[][] dataToBeSorted)
        Parameters:
        left - the left hand sub array of data
        right - the right hand sub array of data
        dataToBeSorted - the data to be sorted
        Returns:
        returns the merged / sorted data
